title: Awesome List Updates on Sep 21, 2023
_seo_title: Awesome List Updates on Sep 21, 2023 - Track Awesome List

items.title: Awesome Go
items.content_text:
### DevOps Tools / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

*   [PipeCD (⭐1.2k)](https://github.com/pipe-cd/pipecd) - A GitOps-style continuous delivery platform that provides consistent deployment and operations experience for any applications.
items.content_html:
DevOps Tools / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

  • PipeCD (⭐1.2k) - A GitOps-style continuous delivery platform that provides consistent deployment and operations experience for any applications.

items.title: Awesome Swift
items.content_text:
### Utility / Barcode

*   [SwiftAutoGUI (⭐60)](https://github.com/NakaokaRei/SwiftAutoGUI) - Used to programmatically control the mouse & keyboard. A library for manipulating macOS with Swift.

Utility / Barcode

  • SwiftAutoGUI (⭐60) - Used to programmatically control the mouse & keyboard. A library for manipulating macOS with Swift.

items.title: Awesome Ipfs
items.content_text:
### Apps

*   [IPFS-FPS (⭐6)](https://github.com/underscoredLabs/webgl-ipfs-fps) - A completely decentralized first person shooter. Built with Unity, Fleek, Unstoppable Domans and Pinata.
*   [killcord (⭐522)](https://github.com/nomasters/killcord) - A censorship resistant deadman's switch
*   [Peer Web Site (⭐187)](https://github.com/Weedshaker/PeerWebSite) - Peer to Peer Web Site hosting at your fingertips! Send full featured HTML (incl. CSS, JS) sites from your browser and attach files eg. videos, images, etc.
*   [Peergos (⭐2.2k)](https://github.com/Peergos/Peergos) - End-to-end encrypted, peer-to-peer file storage and sharing.

### Tools

*   [git-remote-ipfs (⭐232)](https://github.com/cryptix/git-remote-ipfs) - push/pull repositories from/to IPFS.
*   [gomobile-ipfs (⭐342)](https://github.com/ipfs-shipyard/gomobile-ipfs) - IPFS and libp2p on Mobile, with Gomobile.
*   [IPDR (⭐547)](https://github.com/miguelmota/ipdr) - IPFS-backed Docker Registry.
*   [IPFS Setup Action (⭐21)](https://github.com/ibnesayeed/setup-ipfs) - A GitHub Action to install and initialize go-ipfs to provision a cross-platform test environment on GitHub's CI platform.
*   [ipfs-add-from-encrypted (⭐53)](https://github.com/TroyWilson1/ipfs-add-from-encrypted) - Encrypt a file or directory with AES256 then add to IPFS.
*   [ipfs-mount (⭐149)](https://github.com/richardschneider/net-ipfs-mount) - Mount IPFS as a mapped drive on Windows.
*   [ipfs-paste (⭐32)](https://github.com/jbenet/ipfs-paste) - Paste stdin and clipboard to IPFS.
*   [ipfsecret (⭐26)](https://github.com/shlemph/ipfsecret) - Encrypt and decrypt IPFS files with a secret passphrase.
*   [IPLD Explorer (⭐126)](https://github.com/ipfs-shipyard/ipld-explorer) - Explore the Merkle Forest from the comfort of your browser.
*   [Tellit](https://gitlab.com/terceranexus6/tellit) - Encrypt files before uploading them using a keypair or a passphrase.
*   [VIPFS (⭐306)](https://github.com/Ideea-inc/vipfs) - Publish your Vue apps easily to IPFS.
*   [youtube2ipfs (⭐24)](https://github.com/dokterbob/youtube2ipfs) - Download videos from YouTube (and similar video platforms) and add them to IPFS.

### Services & Platforms

*   [Fleek](http://fleek.co/) - Open Web development platform for building, hosting, and storing sites and apps on IPFS, Filecoin, and the Internet Computer.
*   [Fission](https://fission.codes) - Fission builds open source protocols and managed solutions that empower developers to construct scalable and secure software applications.
*   [Peergos](https://peergos.org) - Your private, but social, space online. Store and edit documents and media. Share files or folders with friends.

### Pinning services

*   [Filebase](https://filebase.com/) - Pinning data to IPFS can be hard. Filebase removes that complexity.
*   [NFT.Storage](https://nft.storage/) - Free decentralized storage and bandwidth for NFTs on IPFS & Filecoin.
*   [Web3.storage](https://web3.storage/) - Simple file storage with IPFS & Filecoin.
items.content_html:
Apps

  • IPFS-FPS (⭐6) - A completely decentralized first person shooter. Built with Unity, Fleek, Unstoppable Domans and Pinata.
  • killcord (⭐522) - A censorship resistant deadman's switch
  • Peer Web Site (⭐187) - Peer to Peer Web Site hosting at your fingertips! Send full featured HTML (incl. CSS, JS) sites from your browser and attach files eg. videos, images, etc.
  • Peergos (⭐2.2k) - End-to-end encrypted, peer-to-peer file storage and sharing.

Tools

  • git-remote-ipfs (⭐232) - push/pull repositories from/to IPFS.
  • gomobile-ipfs (⭐342) - IPFS and libp2p on Mobile, with Gomobile.
  • IPDR (⭐547) - IPFS-backed Docker Registry.
  • IPFS Setup Action (⭐21) - A GitHub Action to install and initialize go-ipfs to provision a cross-platform test environment on GitHub's CI platform.
  • ipfs-add-from-encrypted (⭐53) - Encrypt a file or directory with AES256 then add to IPFS.
  • ipfs-mount (⭐149) - Mount IPFS as a mapped drive on Windows.
  • ipfs-paste (⭐32) - Paste stdin and clipboard to IPFS.
  • ipfsecret (⭐26) - Encrypt and decrypt IPFS files with a secret passphrase.
  • IPLD Explorer (⭐126) - Explore the Merkle Forest from the comfort of your browser.
  • Tellit - Encrypt files before uploading them using a keypair or a passphrase.
  • VIPFS (⭐306) - Publish your Vue apps easily to IPFS.
  • youtube2ipfs (⭐24) - Download videos from YouTube (and similar video platforms) and add them to IPFS.

Services & Platforms

  • Fleek - Open Web development platform for building, hosting, and storing sites and apps on IPFS, Filecoin, and the Internet Computer.
  • Fission - Fission builds open source protocols and managed solutions that empower developers to construct scalable and secure software applications.
  • Peergos - Your private, but social, space online. Store and edit documents and media. Share files or folders with friends.

Pinning services

  • Filebase - Pinning data to IPFS can be hard. Filebase removes that complexity.
  • NFT.Storage - Free decentralized storage and bandwidth for NFTs on IPFS & Filecoin.
  • Web3.storage - Simple file storage with IPFS & Filecoin.

items.title: Free for Dev
items.content_text:
### Cloud management solutions

*   [Pulumi](https://www.pulumi.com/) — Modern infrastructure as a code platform that allows you to use familiar programming languages and tools to build, deploy, and manage cloud infrastructure.

### Source Code Repos

*   [plasticscm.com](https://plasticscm.com/) — Free for individuals, OSS, and nonprofit organizations
*   [projectlocker.com](https://projectlocker.com) — One free private project (Git and Subversion) with 50 MB of space
items.content_html:
Cloud management solutions

  • Pulumi — Modern infrastructure as a code platform that allows you to use familiar programming languages and tools to build, deploy, and manage cloud infrastructure.

Source Code Repos

  • plasticscm.com — Free for individuals, OSS, and nonprofit organizations
  • projectlocker.com — One free private project (Git and Subversion) with 50 MB of space

items.title: Awesome Quant
items.content_text:
### Python / Financial Instruments and Pricing

*   [Kelly-Criterion (⭐98)](https://github.com/deltaray-io/kelly-criterion) - Kelly Criterion implemented in Python to size portfolios based on J. L. Kelly Jr's formula.
items.content_html:
Python / Financial Instruments and Pricing

  • Kelly-Criterion (⭐98) - Kelly Criterion implemented in Python to size portfolios based on J. L. Kelly Jr's formula.

items.title: Awesome Directus
items.content_text:
### Extensions / Community

*   [Media AI Bundle (⭐62)](https://github.com/Arood/directus-extension-media-ai-bundle) - Two operations to perform image description and OCR.
*   [Directus Copilot (⭐82)](https://github.com/programmarchy/directus-extension-copilot/) - A bundle including a panel to ask data-aware questions in a chat interface.
*   [OpenAI Automatic Translation (⭐44)](https://github.com/timio23/directus-operation-auto-translate/) - An operaiton to automatically translate new items via OpenAI.
*   [Machine Learning Operations (⭐13)](https://github.com/karamokoisrael/directus-hackathon-submission/) - A set of extensions to train, test and use machine learning models.
items.content_html:
Extensions / Community

  • Media AI Bundle (⭐62) - Two operations to perform image description and OCR.
  • Directus Copilot (⭐82) - A bundle including a panel to ask data-aware questions in a chat interface.
  • OpenAI Automatic Translation (⭐44) - An operaiton to automatically translate new items via OpenAI.
  • Machine Learning Operations (⭐13) - A set of extensions to train, test and use machine learning models.

items.title: Awesome Python Data Science
items.content_text: ### Machine Learning / General Purpose Machine Learning * [Shogun (⭐3k)](https://github.com/shogun-toolbox/shogun) - Machine learning toolbox. ### Deep Learning / Others * [transformers (⭐147k)](https://github.com/huggingface/transformers) - State-of-the-art Machine Learning for Pytorch, TensorFlow, and JAX. * [nnabla (⭐2.8k)](https://github.com/sony/nnabla) - Neural Network Libraries by Sony. ### Natural Language Processing / Others * [torchtext (⭐3.5k)](https://github.com/pytorch/text) - Data loaders and abstractions for text and NLP. * [KerasNLP (⭐913)](https://github.com/keras-team/keras-nlp) - Modular Natural Language Processing workflows with Keras. * [spaCy](https://spacy.io/) - Industrial-Strength Natural Language Processing. * [NLTK (⭐14k)](https://github.com/nltk/nltk) - Modules, data sets, and tutorials supporting research and development in Natural Language Processing. * [CLTK (⭐857)](https://github.com/cltk/cltk) - The Classical Language Toolkik. * [gensim](https://radimrehurek.com/gensim/) - Topic Modelling for Humans. * [pyMorfologik (⭐18)](https://github.com/dmirecki/pyMorfologik) - Python binding for Morfologik. * [skift (⭐232)](https://github.com/shaypal5/skift) - Scikit-learn wrappers for Python fastText. * [Phonemizer (⭐1.4k)](https://github.com/bootphon/phonemizer) - Simple text-to-phonemes converter for multiple languages. * [flair (⭐14k)](https://github.com/zalandoresearch/flair) - Very simple framework for state-of-the-art NLP. ### Computer Audition / Others * [torchaudio (⭐2.7k)](https://github.com/pytorch/audio) - An audio library for PyTorch. * [librosa (⭐7.7k)](https://github.com/librosa/librosa) - Python library for audio and music analysis. * [Yaafe (⭐245)](https://github.com/Yaafe/Yaafe) - Audio features extraction. * [aubio (⭐3.5k)](https://github.com/aubio/aubio) - A library for audio and music analysis. * [Essentia (⭐3.1k)](https://github.com/MTG/essentia) - Library for audio and music analysis, description, and synthesis. * [LibXtract (⭐229)](https://github.com/jamiebullock/LibXtract) - A simple, portable, lightweight library of audio feature extraction functions. * [Marsyas (⭐414)](https://github.com/marsyas/marsyas) - Music Analysis, Retrieval, and Synthesis for Audio Signals. * [muda (⭐234)](https://github.com/bmcfee/muda) - A library for augmenting annotated audio data. * [madmom (⭐1.5k)](https://github.com/CPJKU/madmom) - Python audio and music signal processing library. ### Computer Vision / Others * [torchvision (⭐17k)](https://github.com/pytorch/vision) - Datasets, Transforms, and Models specific to Computer Vision. * [KerasCV (⭐1k)](https://github.com/keras-team/keras-cv) - Industry-strength Computer Vision workflows with Keras. * [OpenCV (⭐83k)](https://github.com/opencv/opencv) - Open Source Computer Vision Library. * [scikit-image (⭐6.3k)](https://github.com/scikit-image/scikit-image) - Image Processing SciKit (Toolbox for SciPy). * [imgaug (⭐15k)](https://github.com/aleju/imgaug) - Image augmentation for machine learning experiments. * [imgaug\_extension](https://github.com/cadenai/imgaug_extension) - Additional augmentations for imgaug. * [Augmentor (⭐5.1k)](https://github.com/mdbloice/Augmentor) - Image augmentation library in Python for machine learning. * [albumentations (⭐15k)](https://github.com/albu/albumentations) - Fast image augmentation library and easy-to-use wrapper around other libraries. ### Feature Engineering / General * [Featuretools (⭐7.5k)](https://github.com/Featuretools/featuretools) - Automated feature engineering. * [Feature Engine (⭐2.1k)](https://github.com/feature-engine/feature_engine) - Feature engineering package with sklearn-like functionality. * [OpenFE (⭐805)](https://github.com/IIIS-Li-Group/OpenFE) - Automated feature generation with expert-level performance. * [skl-groups (⭐41)](https://github.com/dougalsutherland/skl-groups) - A scikit-learn addon to operate on set/"group"-based features. * [Feature Forge (⭐383)](https://github.com/machinalis/featureforge) - A set of tools for creating and testing machine learning features. * [few (⭐51)](https://github.com/lacava/few) - A feature engineering wrapper for sklearn. * [scikit-mdr (⭐125)](https://github.com/EpistasisLab/scikit-mdr) - A sklearn-compatible Python implementation of Multifactor Dimensionality Reduction (MDR) for feature construction. * [tsfresh (⭐8.8k)](https://github.com/blue-yonder/tsfresh) - Automatic extraction of relevant features from time series. * [dirty\_cat (⭐19)](https://github.com/dirty-cat/dirty_cat) - Machine learning on dirty tabular data (especially: string-based variables for classifcation and regression). * [NitroFE (⭐106)](https://github.com/NITRO-AI/NitroFE) - Moving window features. * [sk-transformer (⭐11)](https://github.com/chrislemke/sk-transformers) - A collection of various pandas & scikit-learn compatible transformers for all kinds of preprocessing and feature engineering steps ### Feature Engineering / Feature Selection * [scikit-feature (⭐1.5k)](https://github.com/jundongl/scikit-feature) - Feature selection repository in Python. * [boruta\_py (⭐1.6k)](https://github.com/scikit-learn-contrib/boruta_py) - Implementations of the Boruta all-relevant feature selection method. * [BoostARoota (⭐222)](https://github.com/chasedehan/BoostARoota) - A fast xgboost feature selection algorithm. * [scikit-rebate (⭐418)](https://github.com/EpistasisLab/scikit-rebate) - A scikit-learn-compatible Python implementation of ReBATE, a suite of Relief-based feature selection algorithms for Machine Learning. * [zoofs (⭐247)](https://github.com/jaswinder9051998/zoofs) - A feature selection library based on evolutionary algorithms. ### Visualization / General Purposes * [Matplotlib (⭐21k)](https://github.com/matplotlib/matplotlib) - Plotting with Python. * [seaborn (⭐13k)](https://github.com/mwaskom/seaborn) - Statistical data visualization using matplotlib. * [prettyplotlib (⭐1.7k)](https://github.com/olgabot/prettyplotlib) - Painlessly create beautiful matplotlib plots. * [python-ternary (⭐768)](https://github.com/marcharper/python-ternary) - Ternary plotting library for Python with matplotlib. * [missingno (⭐4.1k)](https://github.com/ResidentMario/missingno) - Missing data visualization module for Python. * [chartify (⭐3.6k)](https://github.com/spotify/chartify/) - Python library that makes it easy for data scientists to create charts. * [physt (⭐135)](https://github.com/janpipek/physt) - Improved histograms. ### Visualization / Interactive plots * [animatplot (⭐416)](https://github.com/t-makaro/animatplot) - A python package for animating plots built on matplotlib. * [plotly](https://plot.ly/python/) - A Python library that makes interactive and publication-quality graphs. * [Bokeh (⭐20k)](https://github.com/bokeh/bokeh) - Interactive Web Plotting for Python. * [Altair](https://altair-viz.github.io/) - Declarative statistical visualization library for Python. Can easily do many data transformation within the code to create graph * [bqplot (⭐3.7k)](https://github.com/bqplot/bqplot) - Plotting library for IPython/Jupyter notebooks * [pyecharts (⭐15k)](https://github.com/pyecharts/pyecharts) - Migrated from [Echarts (⭐64k)](https://github.com/apache/echarts), a charting and visualization library, to Python's interactive visual drawing library. ### Visualization / Map * [folium](https://python-visualization.github.io/folium/quickstart.html#Getting-Started) - Makes it easy to visualize data on an interactive open street map * [geemap (⭐3.7k)](https://github.com/giswqs/geemap) - Python package for interactive mapping with Google Earth Engine (GEE) ### Visualization / Automatic Plotting * [HoloViews (⭐2.8k)](https://github.com/ioam/holoviews) - Stop plotting your data - annotate your data and let it visualize itself. * [AutoViz (⭐1.8k)](https://github.com/AutoViML/AutoViz): Visualize data automatically with 1 line of code (ideal for machine learning) * [SweetViz (⭐3k)](https://github.com/fbdesignpro/sweetviz): Visualize and compare datasets, target values and associations, with one line of code. ### Visualization / NLP * [pyLDAvis (⭐1.8k)](https://github.com/bmabey/pyLDAvis): Visualize interactive topic model ### Deployment / NLP * [fastapi](https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/) - Modern, fast (high-performance), a web framework for building APIs with Python * [streamlit](https://www.streamlit.io/) - Make it easy to deploy the machine learning model * [gradio (⭐39k)](https://github.com/gradio-app/gradio) - Create UIs for your machine learning model in Python in 3 minutes. * [datapane](https://datapane.com/) - A collection of APIs to turn scripts and notebooks into interactive reports. * [binder](https://mybinder.org/) - Enable sharing and execute Jupyter Notebooks ### Data Manipulation / Data Frames * [pandas](https://pandas.pydata.org/pandas-docs/stable/) - Powerful Python data analysis toolkit. * [polars (⭐34k)](https://github.com/pola-rs/polars) - A fast multi-threaded, hybrid-out-of-core DataFrame library. * [Arctic (⭐3.1k)](https://github.com/manahl/arctic) - High-performance datastore for time series and tick data. * [datatable (⭐1.9k)](https://github.com/h2oai/datatable) - Data.table for Python. * [pandas\_profiling (⭐13k)](https://github.com/pandas-profiling/pandas-profiling) - Create HTML profiling reports from pandas DataFrame objects * [cuDF (⭐9k)](https://github.com/rapidsai/cudf) - GPU DataFrame Library. * [blaze (⭐3.2k)](https://github.com/blaze/blaze) - NumPy and pandas interface to Big Data. * [pandasql (⭐1.3k)](https://github.com/yhat/pandasql) - Allows you to query pandas DataFrames using SQL syntax. * [pandas-gbq (⭐475)](https://github.com/pydata/pandas-gbq) - pandas Google Big Query. * [xpandas (⭐26)](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/xpandas) - Universal 1d/2d data containers with Transformers .functionality for data analysis by [The Alan Turing Institute](https://www.turing.ac.uk/). * [pysparkling (⭐270)](https://github.com/svenkreiss/pysparkling) - A pure Python implementation of Apache Spark's RDD and DStream interfaces. * [modin (⭐10k)](https://github.com/modin-project/modin) - Speed up your pandas workflows by changing a single line of code. * [swifter (⭐2.6k)](https://github.com/jmcarpenter2/swifter) - A package that efficiently applies any function to a pandas dataframe or series in the fastest available manner. * [pandas-log (⭐215)](https://github.com/eyaltrabelsi/pandas-log) - A package that allows providing feedback about basic pandas operations and finds both business logic and performance issues. * [vaex (⭐8.4k)](https://github.com/vaexio/vaex) - Out-of-Core DataFrames for Python, ML, visualize and explore big tabular data at a billion rows per second. * [xarray (⭐3.9k)](https://github.com/pydata/xarray) - Xarray combines the best features of NumPy and pandas for multidimensional data selection by supplementing numerical axis labels with named dimensions for more intuitive, concise, and less error-prone indexing routines. ### Data Manipulation / Pipelines * [pdpipe (⭐720)](https://github.com/shaypal5/pdpipe) - Sasy pipelines for pandas DataFrames. * [SSPipe](https://sspipe.github.io/) - Python pipe (|) operator with support for DataFrames and Numpy, and Pytorch. * [pandas-ply (⭐197)](https://github.com/coursera/pandas-ply) - Functional data manipulation for pandas. * [Dplython (⭐763)](https://github.com/dodger487/dplython) - Dplyr for Python. * [sklearn-pandas (⭐2.8k)](https://github.com/scikit-learn-contrib/sklearn-pandas) - pandas integration with sklearn. * [Dataset (⭐201)](https://github.com/analysiscenter/dataset) - Helps you conveniently work with random or sequential batches of your data and define data processing. * [pyjanitor (⭐1.4k)](https://github.com/ericmjl/pyjanitor) - Clean APIs for data cleaning. * [meza (⭐416)](https://github.com/reubano/meza) - A Python toolkit for processing tabular data. * [Prodmodel (⭐58)](https://github.com/prodmodel/prodmodel) - Build system for data science pipelines. * [dopanda (⭐480)](https://github.com/dovpanda-dev/dovpanda) - Hints and tips for using pandas in an analysis environment. * [Hamilton (⭐2.2k)](https://github.com/DAGWorks-Inc/hamilton) - A microframework for dataframe generation that applies Directed Acyclic Graphs specified by a flow of lazily evaluated Python functions. ### Data Manipulation / Data-centric AI * [cleanlab (⭐11k)](https://github.com/cleanlab/cleanlab) - The standard data-centric AI package for data quality and machine learning with messy, real-world data and labels. * [snorkel (⭐5.9k)](https://github.com/snorkel-team/snorkel) - A system for quickly generating training data with weak supervision. * [dataprep (⭐2.2k)](https://github.com/sfu-db/dataprep) - Collect, clean, and visualize your data in Python with a few lines of code. ### Data Manipulation / Synthetic Data * [ydata-synthetic (⭐1.6k)](https://github.com/ydataai/ydata-synthetic) - A package to generate synthetic tabular and time-series data leveraging the state-of-the-art generative models.
items.content_html:
Machine Learning / General Purpose Machine Learning

  • Shogun (⭐3k) - Machine learning toolbox.

Deep Learning / Others

  • transformers (⭐147k) - State-of-the-art Machine Learning for Pytorch, TensorFlow, and JAX.
  • nnabla (⭐2.8k) - Neural Network Libraries by Sony.

Natural Language Processing / Others

  • torchtext (⭐3.5k) - Data loaders and abstractions for text and NLP.
  • KerasNLP (⭐913) - Modular Natural Language Processing workflows with Keras.
  • spaCy - Industrial-Strength Natural Language Processing.
  • NLTK (⭐14k) - Modules, data sets, and tutorials supporting research and development in Natural Language Processing.
  • CLTK (⭐857) - The Classical Language Toolkik.
  • gensim - Topic Modelling for Humans.
  • pyMorfologik (⭐18) - Python binding for Morfologik.
  • skift (⭐232) - Scikit-learn wrappers for Python fastText.
  • Phonemizer (⭐1.4k) - Simple text-to-phonemes converter for multiple languages.
  • flair (⭐14k) - Very simple framework for state-of-the-art NLP.

Computer Audition / Others

  • torchaudio (⭐2.7k) - An audio library for PyTorch.
  • librosa (⭐7.7k) - Python library for audio and music analysis.
  • Yaafe (⭐245) - Audio features extraction.
  • aubio (⭐3.5k) - A library for audio and music analysis.
  • Essentia (⭐3.1k) - Library for audio and music analysis, description, and synthesis.
  • LibXtract (⭐229) - A simple, portable, lightweight library of audio feature extraction functions.
  • Marsyas (⭐414) - Music Analysis, Retrieval, and Synthesis for Audio Signals.
  • muda (⭐234) - A library for augmenting annotated audio data.
  • madmom (⭐1.5k) - Python audio and music signal processing library.

Computer Vision / Others

  • torchvision (⭐17k) - Datasets, Transforms, and Models specific to Computer Vision.
  • KerasCV (⭐1k) - Industry-strength Computer Vision workflows with Keras.
  • OpenCV (⭐83k) - Open Source Computer Vision Library.
  • scikit-image (⭐6.3k) - Image Processing SciKit (Toolbox for SciPy).
  • imgaug (⭐15k) - Image augmentation for machine learning experiments.
  • imgaug_extension - Additional augmentations for imgaug.
  • Augmentor (⭐5.1k) - Image augmentation library in Python for machine learning.
  • albumentations (⭐15k) - Fast image augmentation library and easy-to-use wrapper around other libraries.

Feature Engineering / General

  • Featuretools (⭐7.5k) - Automated feature engineering.
  • Feature Engine (⭐2.1k) - Feature engineering package with sklearn-like functionality.
  • OpenFE (⭐805) - Automated feature generation with expert-level performance.
  • skl-groups (⭐41) - A scikit-learn addon to operate on set/"group"-based features.
  • Feature Forge (⭐383) - A set of tools for creating and testing machine learning features.
  • few (⭐51) - A feature engineering wrapper for sklearn.
  • scikit-mdr (⭐125) - A sklearn-compatible Python implementation of Multifactor Dimensionality Reduction (MDR) for feature construction.
  • tsfresh (⭐8.8k) - Automatic extraction of relevant features from time series.
  • dirty_cat (⭐19) - Machine learning on dirty tabular data (especially: string-based variables for classifcation and regression).
  • NitroFE (⭐106) - Moving window features.
  • sk-transformer (⭐11) - A collection of various pandas & scikit-learn compatible transformers for all kinds of preprocessing and feature engineering steps

Feature Engineering / Feature Selection

  • scikit-feature (⭐1.5k) - Feature selection repository in Python.
  • boruta_py (⭐1.6k) - Implementations of the Boruta all-relevant feature selection method.
  • BoostARoota (⭐222) - A fast xgboost feature selection algorithm.
  • scikit-rebate (⭐418) - A scikit-learn-compatible Python implementation of ReBATE, a suite of Relief-based feature selection algorithms for Machine Learning.
  • zoofs (⭐247) - A feature selection library based on evolutionary algorithms.

Visualization / General Purposes

  • Matplotlib (⭐21k) - Plotting with Python.
  • seaborn (⭐13k) - Statistical data visualization using matplotlib.
  • prettyplotlib (⭐1.7k) - Painlessly create beautiful matplotlib plots.
  • python-ternary (⭐768) - Ternary plotting library for Python with matplotlib.
  • missingno (⭐4.1k) - Missing data visualization module for Python.
  • chartify (⭐3.6k) - Python library that makes it easy for data scientists to create charts.
  • physt (⭐135) - Improved histograms.

Visualization / Interactive plots

  • animatplot (⭐416) - A python package for animating plots built on matplotlib.
  • plotly - A Python library that makes interactive and publication-quality graphs.
  • Bokeh (⭐20k) - Interactive Web Plotting for Python.
  • Altair - Declarative statistical visualization library for Python. Can easily do many data transformation within the code to create graph
  • bqplot (⭐3.7k) - Plotting library for IPython/Jupyter notebooks
  • pyecharts (⭐15k) - Migrated from Echarts (⭐64k), a charting and visualization library, to Python's interactive visual drawing library.

Visualization / Map

  • folium - Makes it easy to visualize data on an interactive open street map
  • geemap (⭐3.7k) - Python package for interactive mapping with Google Earth Engine (GEE)

Visualization / Automatic Plotting

  • HoloViews (⭐2.8k) - Stop plotting your data - annotate your data and let it visualize itself.
  • AutoViz (⭐1.8k): Visualize data automatically with 1 line of code (ideal for machine learning)
  • SweetViz (⭐3k): Visualize and compare datasets, target values and associations, with one line of code.

Visualization / NLP

  • pyLDAvis (⭐1.8k): Visualize interactive topic model

Deployment / NLP

  • fastapi - Modern, fast (high-performance), a web framework for building APIs with Python
  • streamlit - Make it easy to deploy the machine learning model
  • gradio (⭐39k) - Create UIs for your machine learning model in Python in 3 minutes.
  • datapane - A collection of APIs to turn scripts and notebooks into interactive reports.
  • binder - Enable sharing and execute Jupyter Notebooks

Data Manipulation / Data Frames

  • pandas - Powerful Python data analysis toolkit.
  • polars (⭐34k) - A fast multi-threaded, hybrid-out-of-core DataFrame library.
  • Arctic (⭐3.1k) - High-performance datastore for time series and tick data.
  • datatable (⭐1.9k) - Data.table for Python.
  • pandas_profiling (⭐13k) - Create HTML profiling reports from pandas DataFrame objects
  • cuDF (⭐9k) - GPU DataFrame Library.
  • blaze (⭐3.2k) - NumPy and pandas interface to Big Data.
  • pandasql (⭐1.3k) - Allows you to query pandas DataFrames using SQL syntax.
  • pandas-gbq (⭐475) - pandas Google Big Query.
  • xpandas (⭐26) - Universal 1d/2d data containers with Transformers .functionality for data analysis by The Alan Turing Institute.
  • pysparkling (⭐270) - A pure Python implementation of Apache Spark's RDD and DStream interfaces.
  • modin (⭐10k) - Speed up your pandas workflows by changing a single line of code.
  • swifter (⭐2.6k) - A package that efficiently applies any function to a pandas dataframe or series in the fastest available manner.
  • pandas-log (⭐215) - A package that allows providing feedback about basic pandas operations and finds both business logic and performance issues.
  • vaex (⭐8.4k) - Out-of-Core DataFrames for Python, ML, visualize and explore big tabular data at a billion rows per second.
  • xarray (⭐3.9k) - Xarray combines the best features of NumPy and pandas for multidimensional data selection by supplementing numerical axis labels with named dimensions for more intuitive, concise, and less error-prone indexing routines.

Data Manipulation / Pipelines

  • pdpipe (⭐720) - Sasy pipelines for pandas DataFrames.
  • SSPipe - Python pipe (|) operator with support for DataFrames and Numpy, and Pytorch.
  • pandas-ply (⭐197) - Functional data manipulation for pandas.
  • Dplython (⭐763) - Dplyr for Python.
  • sklearn-pandas (⭐2.8k) - pandas integration with sklearn.
  • Dataset (⭐201) - Helps you conveniently work with random or sequential batches of your data and define data processing.
  • pyjanitor (⭐1.4k) - Clean APIs for data cleaning.
  • meza (⭐416) - A Python toolkit for processing tabular data.
  • Prodmodel (⭐58) - Build system for data science pipelines.
  • dopanda (⭐480) - Hints and tips for using pandas in an analysis environment.
  • Hamilton (⭐2.2k) - A microframework for dataframe generation that applies Directed Acyclic Graphs specified by a flow of lazily evaluated Python functions.

Data Manipulation / Data-centric AI

  • cleanlab (⭐11k) - The standard data-centric AI package for data quality and machine learning with messy, real-world data and labels.
  • snorkel (⭐5.9k) - A system for quickly generating training data with weak supervision.
  • dataprep (⭐2.2k) - Collect, clean, and visualize your data in Python with a few lines of code.

Data Manipulation / Synthetic Data

  • ydata-synthetic (⭐1.6k) - A package to generate synthetic tabular and time-series data leveraging the state-of-the-art generative models.

items.title: Awesome Mac
items.content_text:
### Reading and Writing Tools / Note-taking

*   [OutlineEdit 3](https://outlineedit.com) - Fully-featured outline editor, for everyone who loves great structured notes. [![App Store](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-app-store.svg "App Store Software")](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/outlineedit-3/id1608887438)
*   [Saber](https://saber.adil.hanney.org/) - Cross platform stylus and text notetaking app. Supports image and pdf imports, can sync. [![App Store](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-app-store.svg "App Store Software")](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/saber/id1671523739)[![Open-Source Software](https://jaywcjlove.github.io/sb/ico/min-oss.svg "Open Source Software")](https://github.com/adil192/saber)
items.content_html:
Reading and Writing Tools / Note-taking

  • OutlineEdit 3 - Fully-featured outline editor, for everyone who loves great structured notes.
  • Saber - Cross platform stylus and text notetaking app. Supports image and pdf imports, can sync.
